translationTemplates.TranslationTemplate: A regular expression. All files in the test object where the file name matches the regular expression will be check in the test, all other will be excluded. The default value '.*' matches all files.

A regular expression. All test assertions in the executable test suite where the label matches the regular expression will be used in the test run, all other will be skipped. The default value '.*' matches all test assertions.

The maximum number of errors to report for each test assertion. If more errors are found, only the selected number of messages will be reported including an information about the total number of errors found.

The encoding used in the metadata record(s). The allowed values are: 'CSW ISO AP 1.0.0' (default) or 'ISO/TS 19139'. 'CSW ISO AP 1.0.0' uses the schema from the discovery service technical guidance and is based on a draft schema for ISO 19115 and ISO 19119 metadata in XML. 'ISO/TS 19139' uses the official schema for ISO 19115 metadata in XML.

The schema to be used for validating metadata record(s). The allowed values are: '' (no value, the default), 'apiso.xsd', 'apiso-csw.xsd', 'gmd.xsd' or 'gmd-csw.xsd'. The default value triggers validation using the xsi:schemaLocation attribute during test execution. In all other cases the validation occurs during the pre-processing of the XML documents and invalid documents are excluded from the test. 'apiso.xsd' uses the schema from the discovery service technical guidance and is based on a draft schema for ISO 19115 and ISO 19119 metadata in XML. 'gmd.xsd' uses the official schema for ISO 19115 metadata in XML. The variants with the '-csw' suffix also include the CSW 2.0.2 schema that is used in responses from an INSPIRE discovery service. In case of doubt, leave the parameter empty.
Filename
Feature Type
Feature Count
In cases where the referenced test case fails, the test object is not in a condition that this test case could reliably be evaluated.
System error in the Executable Test Suite. Please contact a system administrator. Error information: {text}
Error loading a document. Only well-formed and valid documents are processed. Error information: {text}
There are too many errors to determine all errors. Only the first {count} errors in the system under test are analysed.
The metadata record set has {count} file(s) with errors for this assertion.
The metadata record set has {count} record(s) with errors for this assertion.
The dataset has {count} file(s) with errors for this assertion.
The dataset has {count} feature(s) with errors for this assertion.
XML document '{filename}': The file has {count} error(s).
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The feature has {count} error(s).
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': The metadata record has {count} error(s).

XML document '{filename}': The root element is not a GML feature and not one of the recognised feature collections: wfs:FeatureCollection (WFS 2.0), gml:FeatureCollection (GML 3.2) or base:SpatialDataSet (INSPIRE Base schema 3.2 or 3.3). The name of the root element is '{elementName}' in namespace '{namespace}'. It is recommended to use the WFS 2.0 feature collection element in INSPIRE.
XML document '{filename}': UTF-8 encoding expected. The XML declaration of the document states that '{encoding}' is used as the character encoding.
XML document '{filename}': The root element does not have an xsi:schemaLocation attribute. The document cannot be validated.
XML document '{filename}': The file has {count} schema validation error(s).
XML document '{filename}': {error}
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': The file has {count} schema validation error(s).
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': {error}

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The following properties of the feature have an empty value: {propertyNames}. While this is valid against the XML schema, this is not valid according to the GML model. Please correct the process that generates the GML documents.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The following properties of the feature have a nilReason attribute, but xsi:nil is not set to 'true': {propertyNames}. This is an error in the GML encoding. Please correct the process that generates the GML documents. Typically it was forgotten to add xsi:nil='true' to the property element.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The following properties of the feature have a nil value with an unexpected reason value: {propertyNames}. The nilReason values are: {values}. The nilReason values should either be a URI from the INSPIRE registry (see http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/VoidReasonValue) or from the pre-defined GML values ('unknown', 'other:unpopulated', or 'withheld'). This is an error in the process that writes the INSPIRE GML documents.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A spatial topology element '{elementName}' was found. Spatial properties are limited to the set of geometric types consisting of point, curve with linear interpolation, planar surface, or aggregates thereof. Spatial topology is excluded.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A curve geometry with an invalid curve segment '{elementName}' was found. Curves (standalone or within surfaces) must have linear interpolation (LineString, Curve with LineStringSegment segments).

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A surface geometry with an invalid GML object element '{elementName}' was found. Planar surface types are restricted to Polygon or Surface elements.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A surface geometry with an invalid GML object element '{elementName}' for surface patches was found. Surface patches are restricted to gml:PolygonPatch elements.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A geometry with an invalid GML object element '{elementName}' was found. Supported geometry types are restricted to geometric primitives (points, curves with linear interpolation, or planar surfaces) or aggregates thereof.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A {geometryType} geometry with an invalid GML object element for coordinates '{elementName}' was found. Only {posElementName} is allowed.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A geometric aggregate using the array property '{elementName}' was found. Only the standard properties (gml:pointMember for gml:MultiPoint, gml:curveMember for gml:MultiCurve, gml:surfaceMember for gml:MultiSurface, and gml:geometryMember for gml:MultiGeometry) are allowed.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': Coordinates with a dimension '{dimension}' were found. Only coordinate reference systems with 1, 2 or 3 dimensions are allowed.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The lifespan of the feature ends before it begins (property '{propertyEnd}': '{end}', property '{propertyBegin}': '{begin}'). This is logically incorrect.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A spatial or temporal geometry uses an unexpected coordinate reference system with identifier '{rsid}' that cannot be retrieved. Every URI must be a HTTP URI in a CRS register that when retrieved with HTTP GET returns a definition of the reference system.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The property '{propertyName}' has a value '{value}' that cannot be retrieved using HTTP. Every code list value must be made available in an online registry.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A spatial geometry uses an unexpected coordinate reference system '{crs}'. Please refer to table 2 of the data specification for the list of expected coordinate reference systems.

XML document '{filename}': The default coordinate reference system stated in the bounding box of the feature collection has an unexpected value '{crs}'. Please refer to table 2 of the data specification for the list of expected coordinate reference systems.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': The metadata record references none of the expected coordinate reference systems. The following reference system code have been referenced: '{crs}'. Please refer to table 2 of the data specification for the list of expected coordinate reference system codes.
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': The metadata record does not specify the coordinate reference system(s) used in the dataset.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A temporal geometry uses an unexpected coordinate reference system '{crs}'. Only 'http://www.opengis.net/def/trs/ISO-8601/' is allowed.
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': Every metadata record must document the encoding in which the dataset is available, but this record does not have a 'distributionFormat' property.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': Every metadata record must document the encoding in which the dataset is available and specify the name, version and specification of the encoding, but this record does not have the '{missing}' property.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': The metadata record specifies a character encoding that is not one of the known, valid character set codes (like, for example, 'utf8' or '8859part2'). The following code was found: '{code}'.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': Every metadata record must document the spatial representation types used in the dataset, but this record does not have a 'spatialRepresentationType' property.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': The metadata record specifies a spatial representation type that is not one of the known, valid codes (like, for example, 'vector' or 'grid'). The following code was found: '{code}'.
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': Every metadata record must have an abstract, but this record does not have an 'abstract' property.
XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': Every metadata record must have a title, but this record does not have a 'title' property.

The XML documents representing the spatial data set do not contain a feature of any of the spatial object types in the application schemas of the data theme '{theme}'. Therefore, the spatial data set cannot conform to this conformance class. If you have expected to find spatial objects from the application schemas in the data set, please consult the statistics information to see the spatial object types that have been found.

The XML documents representing the spatial data set do not contain a feature of CadastralParcel. If you have expected to find CadastralParcel spatial objects in the data set, please consult the statistics information to see the spatial object types that have been found.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The dataset includes not only spatial objects with the network representation, but also spatial objects with the corresponding topographic area representation. However, the geometry of this network object is not within the polygons of the corresponding topographic objects. The two representations may be spatially inconsistent, but it may also be that the topographic objects for this part of the network are not included in the dataset. Please review the spatial consistency of this network object with any topographic objects in the area, typically by using a GIS.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The feature shares a common area with another feature ({featureType} '{gmlid2}') at the same level (level {level}) of administrative hierarchy. The shared area: {sharedArea}.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': Not all related boundary features form closed rings. The boundary features are: {featureType2} '{gmlids}'). The open boundary geometries area: {openBoundaries}.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The feature does not correspond to an edge in the topological structure formed by the complete boundary graph of all AdministrativeUnit features. It is not on the boundary of any AdministrativeUnit in the dataset.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The property '{property}' has a value '{value}' that is not one of the allowed values listed at {codelist}.

If the identificar is encoded as a CharacterString, this element shall not be empty. Otherwise, if it is an Anchor element, the xlink:href attribute shall not be empty.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': If the conformity of a dataset or service has not been evaluated, the according metadata record must contain a domain consistency element with a conformance result. The conformance result must have a 'pass' property that, if empty, indicates that conformity has not been evaluated yet. In this case, the 'pass' property element must have an XML attribute gco:nilReason='unknown'. This record has a conformance result with empty 'pass' property element but without such an XML attribute.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': A dataset (series) metadata record must have a valid bounding box that defines the extent of the resource in geographic space. The bounding box is valid if: 1) it has four coordinates (given in decimal degree with a precision of at least 2 decimals), 2) both west- and east-bound longitude are greater than or equal to -180.00, and smaller than or equal to 180.00, 3) both south- and north-bound latitude are greater than or equal to -90.00, and smaller than or equal to 90.00, 4) south-bound latitude is smaller than or equal to north-bound latitude. At least one of these criteria is not fulfilled for one of the geographic bounding boxes of this metadata record. The provided values of this bounding box are: west-bound longitude = '{west}', east-bound longitude = '{east}', south-bound latitude = '{south}', north-bound latitude = '{north}'.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': No valid resource constraint limitations is provided for this record. Limitations on public access (or lack of such limitations) for the described resource shall be described using exactly one gmd:resourceConstraints/gmd:MD_LegalConstraints element. This element shall not be the same one as used for describing conditions applying to access and use. A metadata record must have a gmd:accessConstraints element with a gmd:MD_RestrictionCode element with code list value "otherRestrictions". Additionally, at least one instance of gmd:otherConstraints shall be given describing the actual limitations. If limitations apply, the gmd:otherConstraints shall include a gmx:Anchor element pointing to one of the values from the INSPIRE code list for LimitationsOnPublicAccess If no limitations apply, the gmd:otherConstraints shall include a gmx:Anchor element pointing to the value "noLimitations" in the INSPIRE code list LimitationsOnPublicAccess (http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/LimitationsOnPublicAccess/noLimitations)

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': No resource valid constraint limitations is provided for this record. If "http(s)://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/LimitationsOnPublicAccess/" link is provided, please check if this is pointing to valid prefix.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': No valid resource constraint conditions is provided for this record. A metadata record must have an gmd:accessConstraints or gmd:useConstraints element with an gmd:MD_RestrictionCode element with code list value "otherRestrictions". Additionally, at least one instance of gmd:otherConstraints shall be given describing the actual conditions: If no conditions apply, gmd:otherConstraints shall include a gmx:Anchor element pointing to the value "noConditionsApply" of the INSPIRE code list ConditionsApplyingToAccessAndUse. (http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/ConditionsApplyingToAccessAndUse/noConditionsApply) If the conditions are unknown,gmd:otherConstraints shall include a gmx:Anchor element pointing to the value "conditionsUnknown" of the INSPIRE code list ConditionsApplyingToAccessAndUse (http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/ConditionsApplyingToAccessAndUse/conditionsUnknown). In other cases, gmd:otherConstraints shall include a non-empty free text element with a textual description of the conditions in the language of the metadata.

XML document '{filename}', record '{id}': No resource valid constraint conditions is provided for this record. If "http(s)://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/ConditionsApplyingToAccessAndUse/" link is provided, please check if this is pointing to "noConditionsApply" or to "conditionsUnknown".
